Colgate is an American brand of toothpaste and toothbrushes. It is owned by Colgate-Palmolive. Colgate toothpaste was first sold by the company in 1873, sixteen years after the death of its founder, William Colgate.
Colgate is an umbrella brand principally used to sell oral hygiene products such as toothpastes, toothbrushes, mouthwashes and dental floss.
Colgate-Palmolive is an American multinational consumer products company.
Colgate-Palmolive Company is an American multinational consumer products company headquartered on Park Avenue in Midtown Manhattan, New York City.
The toothpaste is a paste or gel dentifrice used with a toothbrush to clean and maintain the aesthetics and health of teeth.
